skill.name: webhook-tester
skill.description: Test webhook integrations locally with tunneling, inspection, and debugging tools.
skill.summary: Test webhook integrations locally with tunneling, inspection, and debugging tools.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill containing documentation and code examples for webhook testing. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution.

content.value_statement: Webhook integrations are difficult to test because they require internet-accessible endpoints. This skill provides tunneling tools, inspection techniques, and debugging strategies to test webhooks on your local machine.
actual_capabilities: Set up local webhook receivers with Express.js and Python Flask
Expose localhost to internet using tunneling tools like ngrok and cloudflared
Verify webhook signatures from GitHub, Stripe, Shopify, and Slack
Inspect and log incoming webhook payloads
Test webhook retry mechanisms and idempotency
limitations: Requires external tools like ngrok or cloudflared for tunneling
Does not execute webhook tests automatically
User must implement the webhook endpoints themselves
Signature verification examples require user-provided secrets

use_cases.title: Test payment webhooks
use_cases.description: Verify Stripe webhook endpoints locally before deploying to production

use_cases.title: Debug deployment webhooks
use_cases.description: Inspect GitHub webhooks during CI/CD pipeline development

use_cases.title: Validate third-party webhooks
use_cases.description: Test webhook endpoints from various providers before going live

prompt_templates.title: Basic webhook setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up a local webhook receiver to test GitHub webhooks. Include Express.js code with signature verification.

prompt_templates.title: Tunnel configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I expose my local webhook server to the internet using ngrok? Show the configuration steps.

prompt_templates.title: Signature verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a function to verify GitHub webhook signatures using HMAC SHA-256. Include timing-safe comparison.

prompt_templates.title: Retry testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to simulate webhook retry failures and test exponential backoff behavior.

output_examples.input: Help me set up a local webhook receiver for testing
output: Express.js webhook receiver with signature verification
Raw body parser for correct signature calculation
Logging of all headers and payload
Quick response pattern (under 10 seconds) for GitHub compatibility
Environment variable support for webhook secrets

best_practices: Always verify webhook signatures using HMAC before processing payloads
Respond quickly (within 10 seconds) to prevent timeout failures
Implement idempotency using unique webhook IDs to handle duplicate deliveries
Use HTTPS endpoints and validate origin in production environments
anti_patterns: Processing webhooks synchronously without acknowledging receipt first
Skipping signature verification in development or testing environments
Storing webhook secrets in source code instead of environment variables
Not implementing rate limiting or request validation on webhook endpoints

faq.question: Which tunneling tools are supported?
faq.answer: ngrok, cloudflared, localtunnel, and VS Code port forwarding are all covered in the documentation.

faq.question: What webhook providers can I test?
faq.answer: GitHub, Stripe, Shopify, Slack, and Twilio webhooks are all covered with signature verification examples.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything?
faq.answer: This skill provides code examples. You will need Node.js or Python installed plus a tunneling tool like ngrok.

faq.question: Is my webhook data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides instructions. Your webhook data stays on your machine and your chosen tunneling service.

faq.question: Why is my webhook not being received?
faq.answer: Check that your tunnel is running, your endpoint is correct, your server is listening, and you have proper firewall settings.

faq.question: How is this different from online tools?
faq.answer: Online tools like webhook.site are great for quick tests. This skill helps you build persistent local test infrastructure.
